text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that if there is evidence to support a defamation judgment substantially higher than \u00a31.4 million (like \u00a33 or \u00a34+ million), it may be worth pursuing the defamation case. The candidate answer strongly advises taking the money and focuses on the negative aspects of a defamation trial (reputation accelerant, messy record, cost) without quantifying or weighing the potential financial upside of a successful defamation suit against the \u00a31.4 million offer, which is the core requirement of the criterion.", "criterion_id": "8c418610-a213-4ff9-95ff-266829c8a5f0"}
